code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:patient presents with 6 weeks history of worsening mild easy bruising, mild menorrhagia, mild non pruritic rash and Blood. she is a 63 yo female tennis player. Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life o:Height 64 in, Weight 103 lbs, Temperature 98.4 F, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 14, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed dexamethasone - 40 mg daily x 4 days, and ordered CBC.

s:64 YO white F presents with increased mild menorrhagia, mild non pruritic rash and mild easy bruising over 2 years. o:Height 64 in, Weight 103 lbs, Temperature 98.8 F, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed dexamethasone - 40 mg daily x 4 days, and ordered CBC.
